Title: BW Singapore heads to Spain to load cooldown cargo ahead of deployment at Ravenna as FSRU
Description: The BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has left Siciliy and is signalling arrival at Spain’s Cartagena LNG terminal to reload LNG and cool down its tanks ahead of its start-up as a floating import terminal in Ravenna.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Power FSRU anchors off German coast after end of sub-charter with federal government
Description: The Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has left the 9.9 mtpa Deutsche Ostsee LNG import terminal in Mukran following Deutsche Regas's termination of its sub-charter agreement with the German federal government.
Author: JS

Title: EU needs more regulatory oversight on flexible gas storage targets: Kpler Insight
Description: The European Commission should introduce greater regulatory oversight on storage refilling targets, Kpler Insight suggests, following a leaked draft document indicating that the Commission is considering softer targets.
Author: JS

Title: Tokyo Gas takes 20% stake in Philippines terminal owner FGen LNG
Description: Tokyo Gas has acquired a 20% stake in the Philippines’ FGen LNG, the operator of the 5.3 mtpa FGen Batangas floating LNG terminal in southern Luzon. The investment marks the Japanese utility’s first equity participation in an operational LNG terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Seventh Energy Plan: renewables, nuclear lead 2040 targets, LNG supports stability
Description: Japan’s Cabinet has approved the Seventh Basic Energy Plan, with METI publishing revised energy mix targets through 2040 that increase the share of renewables and nuclear power, while continuing to rely on LNG for energy security and supply stability.
Author: CK

Title: Santos’ Barossa gas project nears completion, supporting 3Q 2025 first gas target
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos has reached 91% completion on its Barossa gas project offshore Darwin, Northern Territory, reinforcing its target for first gas production in the third quarter of this year.
Author: CK
